title: Looking for a font similar to the Rolling Stone magazine logo
content: Hey all - I've done a search here but haven't found exactly what I'm looking for - does anyone know of a font that is similar to the Rolling Stone magazine cover font? Thanks!
author: macgee

comments.content: The logo, or the headlines on the cover?
from any time period, I assume its changed over the years...

haven't seen RS in the past year, but last I checked, they were using a lot of stuff from  
Frantisek Storm — most notably Farao.

[http://www.stormtype.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.stormtype.com/ "http://www.stormtype.com/")

Before that, iirc, they were using a lot of Hoefler's Proteus type.

[http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100019](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.typography.com/fonts/font_overview.php?productLineID=100019 "http://www.typography.com/fonts/font\_overview.php?productLineID=100019")

you'll read about Parkinson in the other thread, but here are the links:

Parkinson  
 [http://www.typedesign.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.typedesign.com/ "http://www.typedesign.com/")

and Dennis Ortiz-Lopez  
 [http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.ortiz-lopez.com/ "http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/")

Custom type for Rolling Stone Magazine by Deniz Ortiz-Lopez:  
 [http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/OLP19.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.ortiz-lopez.com/OLP19.html "http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/OLP19.html")  
 [http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/OLP20.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.ortiz-lopez.com/OLP20.html "http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/OLP20.html")
Thanks guys- but I'm looking for a font I can actually use, that mimics the famous logo, not the body or interior type.
You're going to be hard-pressed to find an exact match, but maybe something like [Casey](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Casey) from Font Bureau would work?

you might try Benicia as a starting point ...

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/benicia/black/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/benicia/black/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/parkinson/benicia/black/")

more RS work from Ortiz-Lopez:

[http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/Digital2Part1.01.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150322042654/http:/www.ortiz-lopez.com/Digital2Part1.01.html "http://www.ortiz-lopez.com/Digital2Part1.01.html")
